Battle Start
If the Scholar is in the party at the start of the battle,
the Scholar will reveal one weakness for each enemy type.
New Turn
People3
Welcome to battle! I will talk to you about
the \c[27]Weakness Display\c[0] plugin and about how
it works in the game!
People3
Whenever you hit an enemy with an elemental attack
that they are weak to, the \c[27]Weakness Display\c[0] will
update and reveal that weakness to you permanently.
People3
Give it a try!
People3
Some skills can be used to reveal weaknesses, too.
For example, if you have the \c[27]Scholar\c[0] in your party,
you can use his \c[27]Analyze\c[0] ability to reveal more weaknesses.
People3
If you inflict status effects on an opponent,
then the \c[27]Weakness Display\c[0] will also be updated
to show the status effects they are afflicted
with, too.
People3
Take these and try them out!
\>          Received x8 Bottle of Poison!
\>          Received x8 Bottle of Dust!
\>          Received x8 Bottle of Chaos!
\>          Received x8 Bottle of Sleep!
People3
Looks like you've learned enough!
Let's finish this battle, shall we?
BattleManager.revealWeakness(12)
People3
Welcome to battle! I will talk to you about
the \c[27]Break Shield System\c[0] plugin and about
how it works in the game!
People3
Look next to my name. There is an icon to the
left of it that looks something like \i[15].
That is my current \c[27]Break Shield\c[0] count.
People3
Whenever you hit an elemental weakness of mine,
my \c[27]Break Shield\c[0] will be reduced by 1.
People3
Give it a try!
People3
Whenever anyone, including you and me, reach zero
\c[27]Break Shields\c[0], the shield completely \c[27]Breaks\c[0], and
a new status effect is applied to the broken battler.
People3
In the case of this game, \c[27]Stun\c[0] is applied.
While a battler is \c[27]Stunned\c[0], that battler will
receive double the damage until it wears off!
People3
During this time, I advise you to hit as hard
as you can to defeat the battler! Try it out!
People3
Looks like you've learned enough!
Let's finish this battle, shall we?
BattleManager.revealWeakness(12)
People3
Welcome to battle! I will talk to you about
the \c[27]Boost Point System\c[0] plugin and about
how it works in the game!
People3
If you look at your status window, you may have noticed
there are small icons that look like \i[160] and \i[161] next
to the word \c[27]Boost\c[0].
People3
These are \c[27]Boost Points\c[0]! For each \i[160] there is,
that is a \c[27]Boost Point\c[0] that you can use!
We'll call \c[27]Boost Points\c[0] as \c[27]BP\c[0] for short!
People3
To use them, press \c[27]W\c[0] or \c[27]Page Down\c[0] on the keyboard!
Up to x3 \c[27]BP\c[0] can be used at any given time.
Then, select \c[27]Attack\c[0] and see what happens!
People3
If you've used \c[27]BP\c[0] on your \c[27]Attack\c[0], you may have
noticed that you do some extra hits! Cool, huh?
People3
But if anyone who used \c[27]BP\c[0] on their previous turn,
they won't regenerate any \c[27]BP\c[0] for this turn.
Don't worry, you can still raise your \c[27]BP\c[0] in other ways.
People3
Here, take these and use them to restore your \c[27]BP\c[0].
\>          Received x8 Spirit Tomato!
\>          Received x8 Spirit Tomato (M)!
\>          Received x8 Spirit Tomato (L)!
People3
Did you know \c[27]BP\c[0] can be used with skills, too?
Some skills do more damage when more \c[27]BP\c[0] are used with them!
Other effects include longer durations for status effects.
There's a large variety of effects that can happen!
People3
However, \c[27]Divine Skills\c[0] require you to use x3 \c[27]BP\c[0]
before you can use them! You can think of them
as super moves.
People3
Looks like you've learned enough!
Let's finish this battle, shall we?
BattleManager.revealWeakness(12)
People3
Welcome to battle! I will talk to you about
the \c[27]Weapon Swap System\c[0] plugin and about
how it works in the game!
People3
If you've done the other tutorials, you've probably
realized how important hitting weaknesses are with
these plugin systems in play.
People3
However, did you know you can make this even easier
on yourself by swapping weapons in the middle of battle?
People3
If you press \c[27]Left\c[0] or \c[27]Right\c[0] on the keyboard while the
\c[27]Attack\c[0] option is selected, you can swap the weapon
that you'll be using to attack with.
People3
Give it a try!
People3
Each class in this game can wield multiple weapons.
Swap them around in battle to make hitting enemy
weaknesses easier.
People3
But did you know some skills require certain weapons
to attack with? For those, don't worry about switching
to the weapon before using them. They will automatically
switch to that weapon once they're used.
People3
But if you don't have that weapon equipped at all,
then you cannot use that skill.
People3
Looks like you've learned enough!
Let's finish this battle, shall we?
BattleManager.revealWeakness(12)
People3
Welcome to battle! I will talk to you about
the \c[27]Side Battle Status UI\c[0] plugin and about
how it works in the game!
People3
\c[27]WARNING!\c[0] This plugin requires
Yanfly's \c[27]Battle Engine Core\c[0] to work!
People3
What this plugin does is to move the various UI pieces
in battle to the side so that the player can focus on
the center of battle more. Take a look.
People3
You may have noticed that some of the menus appear
near the party instead of being at the bottom the
whole time, this is to make it more evident which
party member is currently acting.
People3
The command windows have also changed in size, too,
to make it more compact and take up less of the screen.
People3
But most importantly, this plugin also gets rid of
the lag that occurs in vanilla \c[27]RPG Maker MV\c[0] at the
start of each turn by changing the way the UI works.
People3
Looks like you've learned enough!
Let's finish this battle, shall we?
BattleManager.revealWeakness(12)
People3
Welcome to battle! I will talk to you about
the \c[27]Victory Sequence UI\c[0] plugin and about
how it works in the game!
People3
This plugin changes the victory sequence for battle. It puts
together all of the reward information gained from battle onto
a compact screen to display everything at once before the
player goes back to the map scene.
People3
This plugin best works in a game with a higher resolution.
I recommend a \c[27]16:9\c[0] screen ratio of roughly \c[27]1280x720\c[0] size.
People3
And now, let's take a look at the victory sequence!
People3
Welcome to battle! I will talk to you about
the \c[27]Battle System OTB\c[0] plugin and about
how it works in the game!
People3
\c[27]WARNING!\c[0] This plugin requires
Yanfly's \c[27]Battle Engine Core\c[0] to work!
People3
One of the first things you may have noticed with this
new battle system is that there are \c[27]Turn Order\c[0] displays
located at the top of the screen.
People3
These displays tell you which battler will be having their
turn in which order from left to right. The left-most battler
will be able to pick an action and act immediately.
People3
As the turns continue, you may have noticed that the
battlers disappear from the left side of the display.
Once the left is completely emptied out, it becomes a
new turn in battle.
People3
Once a new turn occurs, the turn order on the right side
of the display gets moved to the left and new turn orders
are then calculated for the right.
People3
The \c[27]AGI\c[0] stat matters in calculating the position of the battler
in the turn order, but raising the \c[27]AGI\c[0] during the middle of the
turn will not alter the turn order.
People3
This means that while \c[27]AGI\c[0] is important, it will not necessarily
become an overpowering stat like such found in \c[27]ATB\c[0] and \c[27]CTB\c[0],
nor is it invasive and interrupting like in \c[27]STB\c[0]. \c[27]AGI\c[0] only serves
to calculate the initial positions during a new turn and nothing more.
People3
However, the turn order can be manipulated with some skills.
Using \c[27]Guard\c[0] in this game, for example, will push the user to
the front of the turn order (unless a battler is recovering
from \c[27]Stun\c[0]). Give it a try.
People3
Combined with the \c[27]Weakness Display\c[0], the \c[27]Break Shield system\c[0],
the \c[27]Boost Point system\c[0], and the \c[27]Weapon Swap system\c[0], OTB becomes
a battle system with immense depth.
People3
Go and figure out the strategies which work best for you
in this battle system! Have fun!
People3
Looks like you've learned enough!
Let's finish this battle, shall we?
